tr.td: Persons interested only to swear to.

head.key: See Daths of Allegiance and Superemacy.

tr.td: Prisoner in Custody charged and detained for want of Sureties for Appearance; within what Time Plaintiff may declare.
Prisoner not appearing to Declaration, Judgment.
In the King's Bench, Declaration to allege in Custody of what Sheriff, &c.
For the more effectual Discovery and Punishment of.
Persons convicted before a Justice of Deerstealing, or abetting, Penalty £20.
Constables by Warrant may search suspicious Houses.
If Venison, &c. found, and Offender do not give a good Account how he came thereby, Conviction.
Constables may detain Offender not exceeding Two Days, till Distress returned.
Owners of Deer in enclosed Ground may oppose Offenders.
No Certiorari, unless Offender give Security in £50 to pay Proprietor full Costs, &c.
In Actions for executing Act, General Issue may be pleaded.
Persons convicted before a Justice of pulling down Pales, &c. of Ground where Deer kept, to be imprisoned for Three Months.
This Act made more effectual, 5 G.I.c.15. and see c. 28.–9 G. I. c. 22. § 17.but repealed, 16 G. III.c. 30. § 27.
Against Executors, &c. of Executors, &c. of Right.

Statutes 23 Eliz. c.1.–29 Eliz. c.6.–1 Eliz. c. 2. § 14.–3 Jac. I. c. 3. 5. nor any other Law against Papists or Popish Recusants, except 25 Car. II. c. 2. to extend to Dissenters taking the Oath of W. & M. c. 1. and making and subscribing the Declaration of Stat. 30 Car. II. Stat. 2.
Register of Persons taking Oaths and making Declaration.
Persons convicted, &c. under the said Statutes, taking the Oaths, &c. to be discharged from Penalties, &c.
Persons taking the Oaths, &c. not liable to Penalties of Statutes 35 Eliz. c. 1. and 22 Car. II. c. 1. nor to be prosecuted in the Ecclesiastical Court for Non-conformity.
Dissenters meeting with Doors locked, &c. excluded from Benefit of Act.
Dissenters appointed High Constables, &c. making Scruple to take Oaths, &c. may act by Deputy.
Dissenters in Orders, by what Means exempted from the Penalties of Statutes 13 & 14 Car. II. c. 4.–17 Car. II. c. 2. and 22 Car. II. c. 1.
Taking the Oaths, &c. to be registered.
No Person to preach in any Place but with Doors not locked, &c.
Teachers taking the Oaths, &c. exempt from Office.
Protestant Dissenting Ministers taking the Oaths, & c. exempt, 19 G. III. c. 44. § 1.
Justices of Peace may require Persons going to Meeting to take the Oaths, and make and subscribe Declaration.
First Refusal, Imprisonment; and Name certified to Quarter Sessions.
Second Refusal, taken to be a Popish Recusant Convict.
Quakers making a Declaration of Fidelity, and subscribing Profession of Christian Belief, exempted from Penalties of Statutes 5 Eliz. c. 1. and 13 & 14 Car.II. c. 1.
Altered as to Quakers, 8 G. I. c. 6. § 1. and see further 22 G. II.c. 46. § 36.
Such Persons not admitted to make the Declarations but on Oath and Certificate as herein mentioned.
Until Certificate produced, Justice to take Recognizance to produce same.
Affirmation and Declaration of Quakers accepted instead of an Oath, 7 & 8 W. III.c. 34. see 53 G. III. c. 127. § 6.
Laws for Divine Service in force.
Papists, Popish Recusants, and Persons denying the Trinity, excepted from Benefit of this Act.
Repealed, as to Persons denying the Trinity, 53 G. III.c. 160. § 1.
Disturbers of Religious Worship, Recognizance, or in Default imprisoned, and on Conviction, Penalty £20.
Places of Religious Worship allowed by Act to be certified.
This Act confirmed, 10 Ann.c. 2. § 7. and to be deemed a Public Act, 19 G. III.c.44. § 4. Proviso for the Privileges granted by this Act, 21 G. III. c. 49. § 8.
Goods distrained for Rent may be appraised and sold, if not replevied within Five Days from Distress; Notice with sufficient Security to Sheriff.
See 8 Ann. c. 14. § 5.—Distress may be secured and sold on the Premises,11 G. II.c. 19. § 10.
The like as to Sheaves or Cocks of Corn loose, &c. or Hay in any Barn, &c.
Such Corn or Hay not to be removed by Person distraining, to the Damage of the Owner, until Replevy or Sale.
Pound Breach or Rescous, Treble Damages and Costs.
Wrongful Distress, Double Damages and Costs.
See 11 G. II. c. 19. § 19. and as to Tender of Amends, § 20. of that Act.
